channel.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
channel.description:
If I buy Assassin's Creed, because of it's price.. I can buy another game along with it, with the exception of GH3.
I'm not sure what other XBOX 360 games are good, so if you can suggest any go ahead.
I currently have: Halo 3, Call Of Duty 4 I don't want: Call Of Duty 5
pleax, etc

fuck guitar hero off, unless you have a guitar for it.

it all really depends what ur into, i have half those games there and they are all shit. the only game i like is soul calibur 4, simply because its so easy and fun for an hour.[/quote]
I don’t like Fallout because it’s basically Oblivion but set in a different time, I like Oblivion much better, which I’ve been playing on and off for the past 3 years.

item.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:65, topic:265280”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=350225.msg2695972#msg2695972 date=1236281577]
You still don’t get the whole purpose of GH and Rock band. So till you do, hush up.
[/quote]
what is the purpose of it then? you can’t just sit there and be like, you dont get it shut up. Why not try actually explaining it[/quote]

I don’t play video games as an attempt to emulate the same activity in real life. I don’t play racing games because I want to race in real life, I don’t play assassins creed because I want to be an assassin, and I sure as hell don’t play guitar hero because I want to play guitar.

It’s a fun and challenging game. It’s like constant perfect timing to the rhythm of the music. And it’s especially fun when you get better and your fingers are going lightspeed and doing things they could never do before. The best part about it is playing it with friends.

Read full topic

item.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:61, topic:265280”]You can’t materialize a guitar, a band, and/or songs to play either. You’d have to buy that as well. So it does apply.

I was referring to when you were saying it’s a limited version of an activity anyone can do.

So are war games. They’re limited versions of real life activities anyone can do.[/quote]
yes but going to war has some considerable drawbacks, like oh i don’t know death. the worst that could happen to you with a guitar is a string snaps and whips you on the finger. As for a band you can play a song in the background and play along with it. A guitar can be easily obtained at a shop whereas i dont think your local argos keeps aston martin’s in stock do you? Songs to play are littering the internet for people to find and play and if you were that concerned about it you would write your own
EDIT:

Thug-life:

Still not making sense sanga, my suggestion: SHUT THE FUCK UP.

oh and you are

Read full topic

@sanga282 wrote:

No its not the same with war or racing games, how often do you get up one day and say ‘you know what i’d like to play call of duty let me just go and sign for the latest war for an hour and see how it goes’ its completely different again with racing games you cant just materialize a racing track and an aston martin and race. You cant say that my argument against GH applies to war and racing games because it quite clearly doesnt

item.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:58, topic:265280”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=350225.msg2695922#msg2695922 date=1236276703]

The point is having a good time.

I could very easily roll a ball over some sticker dots and make some little tissue paper ghosts chase it, but I don’t think it would be as fun as Pac Man.

What is the point of Home? What is the point of Live or PSN? I have friends I can go and talk to them. Why play Little Big Planet if I’m living on one already? Why do anything?
[/quote]
How is it a good time if its a limited version of a real life activity that anyone can do![/quote]

I can say the SAME exact thing about the war games or racing games I mentioned earlier.

It’s a challenge. I play guitar and I have for a long time and I would still rather play Guitar Hero.

It would be more fun to sit around with friends trading off on Guitar Hero or battling than to sit around with friends and trade off an actual guitar.

Read full topic

item.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:51, topic:265280”]sanga, you’re a fuckin idiot.

  1. Like STH said, it is the same with all games - why play call of duty when you can go be in the army? Why play racing games when you can go race on yourself? It’s fuckin pointless.
  2. PS3 IS SHIT, SDFU

Why the fuck did you bring up the PS3 at all? He asked for a game to buy for his 360, the PS3 is totally out of the question.[/quote]
Wow you’re a fucking idiot, did you even read my response to his post? quite evidently not
If you just go and join the army there is no fun element in there because you are in danger and you wont get to do what you want straight away, there are rules, regulations etc tonnes of things that dont exist in a GAME. When playing guitar hero the idea is to emulate playing a guitar, so why the fuck not just play the guitar when it will be exactly the same as the game except there are more options? You just don’t think do you? god damn idiot

Read full topic

item.title: What game should I buy? (XBOX 360)
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

The people who don’t like Guitar Hero either haven’t played it or sucked at it.

It is not about playing guitars, learning guitar, or music at all.

I have yet to have lag on a 360 other than my internet dying out. And only on some games (and half of the games joined) will there be a stupid little kid. Although 95% of the people on live are losers anyway.
